CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 30, 1955, pg. 16 reads: 'Youth on the March' - This was the impression one might have gained had he or she been in attendance at the first Youth Conference held at the Centre Avenue YMCA, April 23-24. The conference was sponsored by the Youth Department of the Branch, with Clarence Rogers Jr. serving as general chairman and Delores Gary secretary.  Jody Harris, acting boys' work secretary of the "YM," supervised the Planning Committee which did an excellent job.  Theme of the conference was "As the Walls Come Tumbling Down," and the 110 delegates from various high schools throughout the area were constantly reminded of the preparation required to meet the demands of integration in employment and social living.  Saturday evening at the banquet, the delegates heard an inspiring address by Atty. James B. Simmons Jr., City Councilman of Toledo, Ohio...Lower left and right, some of the smart, well-groomed, charming and handsome delegates who, during the conference sessions, displayed remarkable poise and intelligence in discussion and also other commendable traits of leadership...-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group of young men, and young women, including one wearing off the shoulder flora dress, seated at banquet tables for Youth Conference, Centre Avenue YMCA
